intro: Pristimera delagoensis var. delagoensis, commonly known as the Delagoense Pristimera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
